slides.title: Mastering React
slides.subtitle:
Complete Frontend Framework Guide
From Beginner to Advanced Concepts

box.content: JavaScript library for building user interfaces

list.text: Philosophy - Component-based, declarative, learn once write anywhere

note.text: Fun fact: React was originally created to solve Facebook's chat notification performance issues!

box.code:
# Create new React app with Vite
npm create vite@latest my-react-app -- --template react

# Navigate to project
cd my-react-app

# Install dependencies
npm install

# Start development server
npm run dev

# Project structure:
my-react-app/

npx create-react-app my-react-app

# Start development server

list.text: Netlify - Great for static sites, continuous deployment

box.code:
# Build your React app
npm run build

# Install Vercel CLI
npm i -g vercel

# Deploy
vercel

# Or connect GitHub repo for automatic deployments

# Environment variables
# Create .env.local for development
REACT_APP_API_URL=https://api.example.com
REACT_APP_API_KEY=your-api-key

# In Vercel dashboard, add environment variables

# vercel.json configuration
{
  "buildCommand": "npm run build",
  "outputDirectory": "dist",
  "devCommand": "npm run dev",
  "cleanUrls": true,
  "trailingSlash": false,
  "rewrites": [
    { "source": "/(.*)", "destination": "/index.html" }
  ]
}

# For SPAs (Single Page Applications)
# All routes should serve index.html
# Vercel handles this automatically with above config
